project.name: Sunglass Mobile
project.title: Sunglass iOS
project.description: The mobile companion application for Sunglass, allowing people to download, navigate, add annotations, photos and comments on 3d models. This application features a 3d gestural navigation from which one can pan, zoom, and orbit with the tap or drag of their finger. Review and markup models with notes and comments, add images from the device or camera and take snapshots of models and save them to its project. Stay up to date with instant notifications about any changes made to your projects and invite contacts to collaborate in real-time.

project.name: KMDW Homepage
project.title: KMDW Portfolio
project.description: The portfolio website and homepage for the Japanese architectural firm, KMDW. The site emphasizes the diversity of projects in terms of scale, location and program and allows people to navigate projects by filtering them according to these criteria. The navigation and information design is subtle and sits back allowing the images of projects to tell the story. The portfolio is also organized into major concepts which the firm addresses in every project and allows one to move in between viewing different aspects of projects which embody that embody key concepts and the projects in entirety.

project.name: Seiyu
project.title: Seiyu
project.description: A design prototype that to be applied to a number of shopping centers slated for renovation/rebranding owned by a major Japanese retail chain. The scope of the prototype extended across shelving and interior design, wayfinding, branding and graphics proposals, product placement and corresponding marketing campaigns. Furthermore it required developing organizational, circulation and informational logics that could be configured to address to the unique spatial conditions of any store.

project.name: Code
project.title: Code
project.description: Website For my Programming Projects.

project.name: Germania
project.title: Germania
project.description: Typeface based on Hans Haacke Installation.

project.name: Thesis
project.title: Featherweights
project.description: Thesis for the Degree of Master of Architecture at MIT that examines vacant urban parcels that are either unviable for development or stalled as a result of the economic crisis, and asks: How is it possible to generate both economic and urban value on these sites until they are ready to be developed? Reluctant to invest in these areas developers resort to a wait-and-hold strategy leaving parcels vacant until the market is suitable for development. For these parcels, the conventional architectural process is stalled because the time and investment needed for design and construction outweighs the expected return on the development. This condition occurs throughout all major cities in the United States and is becoming more prevalent as the frequency of urban utilization cycles increases. This thesis proposes that a designer can use architecture as a platform to navigate the unique demands of this condition by rapidly capturing the value of a parcel, thereby creating positive returns to the surrounding communities as well as landowners. Rather than acting as a conventional designer who develops a specific proposal for a particular site, this thesis proposes that a designer proactively provide a service to a developer that generates unique design solutions to a particular condition. This is accomplished by establishing a design protocol that allows one to move from analysis to deployment of unique and dynamic architectural proposals for a range of uses and sites simultaneously while dramatically compressing both the time and cost required for design and construction.

project.name: Tofu Nets
project.title: Form Finder
project.description: For decades designers have experimented with simulating its structural behavior and geometric implications through “Form Finding”. Techniques in form finding are best known through the hanging chain models of Antonio Gaudi as well as the physical models of Frei Otto who experimented with a number of physical modeling techniques to discover highly accurate structural forms. Recently, methods such as dynamic relaxation and force density have been employed for analyzing and optimizing structural forms. While these methods have led to a number of tools for refining structural forms, very few design tools exist for exploring and creating new structural forms. Using particle springs systems, this tool allows one to work live and compose cable net structures by simulating the forces that govern their structural forms. One can import geometry, which the tensile cable net structure can be modeled around, allowing for the design of a structural system that integrates with other building features and responds to unique site conditions. This tool offers a kit of parts for modeling and manipulation based on the basic elements of cable net systems such as masts, joists, cables, and nets and can choose between geodesic and radial net geometries.

project.name: FW_Typology
project.title: Typology
project.description: In schematic design the architect is charged with developing and evaluating a number of configurations bringing them into the site at a diagrammatic level. In order to accomplish this architects develop rules and constraints for ordering spaces and bringing them into a coherent whole. Furthermore the architect balances a set of values or goals that they have in the project and tries to achieve all of them. This phase is experiment, different systems are changed, rules are tweaked and compromises between values are established until they reach something acceptable. This tool automates the process of schematic design based by organizing a set of spaces onto a given site according to defined objectives through the use of computational methods, namely simulated annealing. One can then tip the scales in order to bias one objective over another based on personal values, while iteratively shifting constraints and position. This enhances the schematic design process, by both compressing its time span and allowing it to be dynamic.

project.name: FW_Adjacency
project.title: Adjacency
project.description: This application loads a set of spatial descriptions as nodes into an interface which allows a user to graphically compose an adjacency graph for the set of nodes which is then used in determining configurations of each of those spaces.

project.name: Spectre
project.title: Spectre
project.description: Rather than contribute to the rapidly growing economy of moving images saturating peoples perception, and in effect rendering audiences’ relationship to the medium less meaningful this project seeks to decomposes and degrade existing images. Footage is harvested from various internet sources and translated into basic numeric information – arrays of pixels with color values defined as 32 bit integers, or 4 bytes. The range of integer values that can be stored in 32 bits is 0 through 4,294,967,295 which in digital images, can refer to 24-bit true-color(red, green, blue) images with an 8-bit alpha(opacity) channel. Through the development of a java application, these values are manipulated and recorded in real time through operations such as shifting pixel locations, flooding color channels, changing opacity and adding noise both removing images from there context and abstracting them into ghostly appearing figures. Recordings are then compiled and composed into a video, as representation of some haunting experience, a video apparition.

project.name: Market On Blast
project.title: Market On Blast
project.description:
The Uruguaiana Popular Market is an informal market place in Rio De Janiero, conceived in the 1980s in order to centralize and organize street vendors that were popping up around the city, it has transformed from a modest set of ordered stalls into a dense chaotic marketplace in which one can buy anything from laundry detergent, electronics and bootleg DVDs, music and software.
With questions of energy generation and ownership, this proposal reimagines the informal market place for the 21st century. Firstly it takes the traffic flows from different surrounding areas that alter between daily commutes to the surrounding downtown area and nightly traffic from surrounding residential areas north of the site to southern entertainment and nightlife activities, and create a kind of binary public space. In which the market that transforms itself into an event space at night. through two layers which and interwoven circulation, the market on the street level and upper gathering spaces. Celebrating the local practice of mass musical gatherings that take place, and the corresponding market of wares associated with them. Furthermore it employs a solar canopy that both responds to the movement of the sun as well as market activity to provide shade and collect energy during the day which provides electricity for performances at night.

project.name: Bow Facade
project.title: Bow Facade
project.description: This definition was developed with an interest in the ability of materials to bend or flex and was used for generating a facade screen system. By takinga sheet of stiff but flexible material and intrudicing a variety of slits into that sheet as well as applying a force one can creating a number of unique bowing forms. This definition models those forms and corrosonding cutsheets for fabrication.

project.name: Space Viewer
project.title: Gestural Space Navigator
project.description: This project seeks to create an intuitive and novel way for interacting and navigating three dimensional spaces through a two dimensional surface and the gestures of ones own body. Simple gestures are mapped to the manipulation of a virtual camera and space. Through ones movement one can simultaneously pan, zoom and orbit around models. This is accomplished by tracking ones movements via infrared sensors attached to ones fingers which are tracked with a "Wimote". Through this act it is hoped that a greater relationship between the user and some three dimensional object, graph or space is established both bridging the virtual and the physical and bringing clarity to complex and confusing three dimensional structures and systems.

project.name: Trefoil Paramorph
project.title: Trefoil Paramorph
project.description: How can digital tools and processes enable us to rethink the way we draw and the way we arrive at form? As a response to this question and the agenda of using parametric modeling to challenge architecture formally Trefoil Paramorph examines the trefoil knot, a topological closed surface whose unique geometric properties have fascinated architects in past, popularized by UN Studio's Mercedes Benz Museum. In an exercise to create a proposal for movie studio complex for Plymouth Studios, which incorporated a film school and museum ,the Trefoil Paramorph was used for its circulatory benefits for social interaction, that would interact through the weaving of circulation paths to unify three disinterested programs, and their of inhabitants.

project.name: CNC Chair
project.title: Digital Plywood Chair
project.description: asdf

project.name: Cafe Disco
project.title: Cafe Disco
project.description: Developed for a digital fabrication class this defition is born from an interests in new techniques of transforming flat materials into 3d forms. By intrudicing a variety of perferations into a sheet of metal and then bending it one can create a number of unique forms based on the size and location of the perforations which effect the metals strength and direction it will bend.

project.name: Vault
project.title: Vault 201
project.description: Installation for Cooper Hewitt Triennial: “Why Design Now?” to Create a thin shell Vault based on the work of Rafael Guastavino. The challenges of this project were to use digital methods to arrive at forms never before possible as well as design a fabrication method that can allow a structure, which depends on its formal precision in order to function to be constructed by unskilled labor. Using catenary equations from structural design, A parametric model was constructed that allows one to manipulate force lines throughout a surface which is then rationalized into the specified bricks while Formwork and cut files to control a CNC router are generated, allowing one to seamlessly move from design to fabrication while working with shifting constraints such as brick dimensions or count. Bricks were manufactured by Green Leaf bricks made out of 100 percent post-consumer and post-industrial recycled material…including 30 percent processed sewage waste.

project.name: Waveform Generator
project.title: Waveform Generator
project.description: This simple application was an opportunity to play with the really powerful Minim Library for Processing. Through this interface combine, modify and remove a number of sound waves to create a unique sound.

project.name: Los Altos
project.title: Between Landscape and Light
project.description: The uniqueness and beauty of the Los Altos Hills lies in its temperate Mediterranean climate and the diversity of its ecosystem. These site characteristics give rise to the organizational logic of the project. The various programmatic elements are grouped and distributed amongst the grove of existing oak trees. In an effort to reduce ambient site noise and minimize the visual impact of the buildings, the structures are sunken several feet beneath grade creating a large internal court. The long linear walls which define the structures cut oblique lines in the landscape, opening the court outward towards the morning sunlight and views to the valley. The massive walls of concrete and rammed earth which contain the sunken buildings are balanced by a delicate filigree of wooden slatting and large pivoting steel and glass windows. The assembly of spaces nestled into the landscape is covered by simple shed roofs which open towards the court, creating a band of perimeter pavilions. The floating roofline strikes a sublime contrast to the low arc of the surrounding landscape. The roofs of the bedroom pavilions slant in the opposite direction, defining a second, more intimate courtyard which serves as a recreational extension of the bedrooms. Morning sunlight reflects off the pool and into the master bedroom which floats above the courtyard. The staff wings are sunken beneath the elevated ground plane, peeling-up towards one another to create a staff activity zone, obscured from view while retaining a tight functional relationship to the core of the house.

project.name: Palermo
project.title: Palermo Housing
project.description: Palermo presents the interesting situation where the urban fabric is so fine grained that any architectural proposal of contemporary scale against it is an urban intervention. This project explored the relationship between the architectural artifact and its urban consequences.This project features Housing, a public theatre which flanks a large plaza which landscapes the dramatic sectional difference of the site to reveal significant views of the city as well as use the architectural object as an urban intervention by redirecting flows across the city through the plaza.

project.name: Slick and Tasteful
project.title: Slick and Tasteful
project.description: Information graphic spread measuring statistics such as population of architects, architectural salaries, and population of students in various countrie againts gdp, human development index and poverty line etc.

project.name: Rustic Canyon Paintings
project.title: Haldeman Rd Paintings
project.description: Recent Paintings

project.name: White Arrows
project.title: White Arrows
project.description: Design for White Arrows Logo, first album and various merchandise.

project.name: Ruffles and Rot
project.title: Ruffles & Rot
project.description: Ruffles & Rot is a group exhibition curated by Vera Neykov and Robin Willis. 16 artists were asked to create wallpaper patterns focusing on themes of decay, death and decadence. Their interpretations range from social to historical, through biological and personal. The surface of the wallpaper, and the patterns illustrated, are presented through an array of techniques including images, drawings and words.

project.name: Media Lab Mapping
project.title: Media Lab Mapping
project.description: Various projects in developing new interactive spatial wayfinding systems for MIT's Media Lab extension.

project.name: FNDTN
project.title: FNDTN
project.description: The South Boston Waterfront is in flux. Twenty years from now the environment will be completely transformed from one that is characterized by highways, shipping yards and parking lots into a skyline of massive isolated towers, groups of towers each with their own logic and contained environments. Why can't a building anticipate the development of its surroundings? Why can't cities develop in vertical stages? Because creating a project on the same scale as these is not possible due to restrictions and program briefing, I propose to create a building that serves as a foundation for a series of buildings to grow on top of it, reinforcing the density and interiorized urbanism that is coming to the area through a series of smaller increments. The building provides flexibility for future development on top of it by providing a number of points for future structures to bear on. The structure branches out providing different spans and grains from floor to floor to meet the different needs of programs. At the top level where it is lightest and densest allows for the integration of shelving, as it branches down it provides larger spans for a network of civic programs and transportation.

project.name: Symbiosis
project.title: Symbiosis
project.medium: College Campus and Surrounding Urban Context
project.description: Group Project focusing on the rebuilding and expansion of University Campus in Taipei. Focusing on the ideas of connectiona and division with the surrounding community

project.name: Ikeoku
project.title: Ikeoku
project.description: In response to the decline of population in the area

project.name: Rissei
project.title: Rissei
project.medium: Elemetary School Reuse and Surrounding context
project.description: asdf

project.name: Exquisite Corpse
project.title: Exquisite Corpse
project.description: In response to the question- how can the prevalent new typology of big box shopping, which typically is established in mass on the periphery of cities creating nowhere spaces that rely on the automobile for access and suburban model be integrated into dense urban environments. Exquisite corpse proposes that through a simple powerful move - simply tilting the big box on one axis - to create a building that is in fact a shelf for a more informal marketplace , thereby minimizing the buildings footprint. Furthermore it hopes to celebrate shopping and the market place by reimagining the form of commerce that takes place in this building. Image the building as a shelf that can quickly reconfigure itself to meet fluctuating demands for different products. The building consists of a Simple Lightweight Truss structure in which partitions can easily be installed and removed. Vendors rent spaces within the shelf to sell their goods and based on the success or failure of their endeavor they either expand or contract the amount of space they are renting. As the building reconfigures itself the façade of the building changes as it is displaying the act of shopping as the image of the building.

project.name: Recursive Cracking
project.title: Recursive Cracking
project.description: taking advantage of looping structures in programming, Recursive Cracking triangulates a surface through a feedback loop which recursively divides itself according to the mean curvature of the surface at its position. Shallow areas of curvature on the surface are divided less and tighter areas of curvature are divided more creating a more accurate articulation of the surface being processed. this experiment serves as a tool for discretizing a curved surface into planar elements with dynamic geometric relationships.

project.name: Eyebeam
project.title: Eyebeam
project.description: Analysis of Eyebeam Museum

project.name: Crossings
project.title: Crossings
project.description: Exercise: create a “user manual” which analyzes Lechmere Station in order to extract ingredients needed to construct a bus/train station as well as map relationships between passengers, buses and trains as they intersect at the station. Using discoveries from users manual, design a roof, to accommodate and articulate the protocols on the ground plane of the site. the user manual records what different areas of the sight are inhabited by density during different times of the day and in relationship to bus/train arrivals and departures. this mapping displays that often only small areas of the site were inhabited at certain times concluding that the site rarely functions spatially in its entirety. this drove the design of a long span space frame structure that not only bridges the different areas of loading and unloading but through bending and excavating operations provides a singular elevated system of spaces and circulation that unifies the station.

project.name: Slivers
project.title: Slivers
project.description: This non denominal church focuses on axis, it cuts into the courtyard, people can walk through walls and stuff

project.name: Ecoliteracy
project.title: Ecoliteracy
project.description: Ecoliteracy is using one’s relationship to the growth of an organism as a metaphor for the actions and understanding of one’s life, as well as using the understanding of ecological processes as a guide to design and production. Ecoliteracy is a term that as far as I know was coined by a friend and fellow artist Natalie Jeremenko. Who share the idea with me that rather than technological advances saving us from the toll we take on the planet, changes in peoples ideas and relationships attitudes, and ultimately actions towards the environment are more important. That is that the heart of this series of Ecoliteracy projects. They serve as micro-utopic actions and symbolic models for greater change.

project.name: Musical Dope
project.title: Musical Dope
project.description: Monthly Mix Tape

project.name: By Hand
project.title: By Hand Clothing
project.description: I designed patterns and website and Identity for By Hand Clothing Company

project.name: Designing Crime
project.title: Designing Crime
project.description: An ongoing website and blog of various work and inspiration that doesn't fit in anywhere else.

project.name: Playbin
project.title: Playbin
project.description: Information, media and other materials, which are such an important source of creativity and expression, are becoming overwhelmingly monopolized by commercial interests through the use of copyright. Copyright, originally indented to protect artists from the theft of their work, now endangers artistic production itself. Playbin is a network of free artistic and creative materials. The goal is to set these materials free from ownership and create a community around them from which everyone can use, learn from and develop. Every member of Playbin is given a certain amount of space on its server to upload whatever there heart desires. This could be photographs, tools, programs, typefaces, incomplete work, in progress work, unrealized projects, drawings, paintings, writings, music, video etc. By uploading a file you give the rights to all other members of Playbin (under the Creative Commons License) to build on top of your work however they like provided they credit your original piece and re-share their own developments. Recycle, share, discuss, and circulate unused artistic material and keep it alive. Please help us create a system that functions to fit your needs by testing the first version and providing feedback about how we can improve it.

project.name: Diorama
project.title: Diorama
project.description: The diorama is a stage for observation and analysis. It illustrates an environment and the systems that exist within it. When one looks into the stage like a model they imagine its proportions growing immensely in scale. The viewer imagines him or herself growing as well in relationship to the object. One wonders if the model they are viewing may actually exist as a section of an infinite landscape, a model of reality. It is an anthropological study of design and desire through creation and display.

project.name: Pioneer
project.title: Cooper Pioneer
project.description: For a year I served as the editor in chief and art director of the Cooper Union school newspaper. At the time most of the issues focused on the current demolition of the Cooper Hewitt building.

project.name: Loft Union
project.title: Loft Union
project.description: The Loft Union is a hypothetical proposal for the renovation of an abandoned building and the transformation of its programming. The Union provides free residence as well as employment for independent artists in exchange for a number of services in the field of community outreach, education and broadcasting. Its goal is to create both an environment where artists can live, as well as participate in a community of art making and intellectual activity that will enrich ones own work. The Union also provides the artist with the means to create and control there work from creation to distribution to the public through interesting, relevant and self-beneficial work

project.name: King of Central Park
project.title: King of Central Park
project.description: asdf

project.name: Influence
project.title: Influence
project.description: Influence: Consumption and Policy is a poster, created in collaboration with David Kim, linking policy makers in Bush's Cabinet with large Conglomerate corporations. As well as making a point of how much influence a small number of people hold on policy and consumption.

project.name: Basel Drawings
project.title: Basel Drawings
project.description: Inspired by Gaston Bachelard’s, Poetics of Space, these drawings explore the intimate relationship between space and memory in the context of a postmodern world where space is perpetual redevelopment.

project.name: Save the World
project.title: Mana
project.description: This project is an information brochure for an imaginary man made island. The island's function is to host a school. The philosophy of the school as well as the design of life on the island is strongly influenced by the ideas of Buckminster Fuller, whose aim is to use design and creativity to create a better world. The project and school are also used as a vessel to harbor my own beliefs about the importance and possibilities of design in the 21st century. The brochure breaks down the functions needed to sustain life on an island into a five systems, the island is divided into facilities to support them which correspond with departments in the school to develop them.. All of the words are written by Robin Willis with exception to the two quotations from Buckminster Fuller.

project.name: Communicate
project.title: Communicate
project.description: A Poster Redesign and reinterpretation of Ralph Schraivogel's poster. The poster is for an exhibition that just took place at the Museum Fur Gestaltung, Zurich - COMMUNICATE: INDEPENDENT BRiTISH GRAPHIC DESIGN SINCE 1960 . The Show is a retrospective of British graphic designers as you might have guess, but all hold the elements of subversion, rebellion and independence in their work.

project.name: Kunst History
project.title: Kunst History
project.description: A Website for the Art History Department of the UNIVERISTY OF BASEL whose studies are strongly linked with the international program EIKONES in researching and developing ideas surrounding "Iconic Turn" theory and the power/meaning of images that confront us. The Concept of this project was to visualize the structure and ways that images, artworks, ideas are connected through influence to create a model of art history, and then to it apply that structure to the website. When you first enter the page you are confronted with a list of words, being names, places, times, ideas and other key pieces of information that define the content of the page. Each of these are linked to different elements of content which are tagged with the same words. By clicking a word you select it and then narrow the field of words to ones that surround the content linked to the word you selected. you can then expand and contract the field of words on the page by selecting and un-selecting words in real time. You can then navigate the content of the site simply by the different ways they are connected. This was made with Javascript, XML, and XSL

project.name: HGK Diplom
project.title: HGK Diplom
project.description: Two poster concepts for the HGK Basel Diplom show. This is the end of the year show for the five departments of the school. My posters just really reflect methods and styles I found interesting and wanted to explore from my time here. Hopp Swiss Design!

project.name: Archetypes
project.title: Archetypes
project.medium: Inkjet on Paper, Binding Board, Binding Cloth
project.description: Archetypes vol 1. / vol 2. is a book that demonstrates a drawing exercise employed in order to study forms in nature and design. First forms are chosen in nature these are studied and slowly abstracted focusing on the structures within them. These objects are ultimately transformed into buildings whose programming comes out of the structures discovered. Archetypes features a shell, peapod, whale, bird wing and a tree. Archetypes II follows the technique of the first only in greater detail. It studies the transformation of a turtle shell into an opera theatre.

project.name: Tree House Paintings
project.title: Tree House Paintings
project.description: Paintings 2005

project.name: Plant book
project.title: Plant Book
project.description: A book that you can rip up and grow a plant in

project.name: Tadao Ando
project.title: Tadao Ando
project.description: Tadao Ando is the response to an eight-page brochure assignment of any one subject. This one. This brochure documents eight of Tadao Ando’s most important projects to me personally. The brochure examines his work through three fundamental principles, light, concrete and nature. It uses typographic and graphic techniques to translate the feeling of his architecture them from three dimensions to the page. Paper was chosen to reflect his materials and the grid that the brochure was designed over, is left visible, each cell containing a unique id. Drawing connections between architecture and graphic design.

project.name: Timeline
project.title: Timeline
project.description: Timeline is a tool for creating new and interesting animations through simplicity. By saving points of the line along time it can reconstruct the line at the same speed it was drawn at. There are no limits to the amount of lines one can draw and each one is independently customizable. This brings new ideas of what animation and drawing can be. The physical controller created for this program was designed to utilize every limb of the body in harmony. Because time is an essential factor in the intereaction of this application the controller is operated more like an instrument rather than an interface.

project.name: General Attention
project.title: General Attention
project.description: Poster / Catalogue / Card for group show General Attention at Built in New York

project.name: Tofu
project.title: Tofu Tool / Typeface
project.description: In the future, with increasing amounts of information to be managed and new speeds in which it must be composed, design will be dehydrated. Design will be conducted on a new massive scale of production, putting sophistication at the risk of disappearing in order to meet the level of efficiency needed. Tofu will allow a designer to start with the most basic version of the typeface and transform it to any degree to create a new level of sophistication in typography and still function efficiently.

project.name: Cantora
project.title: Cantora
project.description: asdf

project.name: Paintings 2005
project.title: Paintings
project.description: This series of paintings investigates a world where the rational and impersonal are balanced against the natural and groundless. Oil paint, house paint, sign painters enamel is applied to canvas in a variety of ways to create flat, drippy, painterly, delicate and sloppy surfaces. Spaces are defined sometimes by only an outline or shape to compose dreamlike architectural scenes forged through balance along an Apollonian-Dionysian axis.

project.name: Color Feild Paintings
project.title: Color Feild Paintings
project.description: Paintings

project.name: Mass Grave
project.title: Mass Grave
project.description: Hudson County is the response to a site specific poster assignment. It was created for the Hudson County Burial Grounds that house unclaimed and unidentified bodies from New York City. The poster can also be transformed into a cardboard box that would serve the purpose of housing the unclaimed remains of the bodies at Hudson County. It is a satiric critique of the inhumanity created through the mass production of personal or even sacred processes.

project.name: Ocean Park Paintings
project.title: Ocean Park Paintings
project.description: Paintings from time spent at Ocean Park studio.

project.name: Cubes
project.title: Cubes
project.description: Written for a randomly generating splash page. This code simply creates a landscape of cubes resembling stone quarry jetties I saw and loved in Spain and Greece.

project.name: Donald Judd
project.title: Donald Judd in 5 Steps
project.description: Donald Judd In Five Easy Steps is a poster and pamphlet that provides instructions for building four of Donald Judd’s designs for various pieces of furniture. It is not intended to poke fun at Donald Judd’s work but rather point out the beauty in the minimalism and geometric relationships of his furniture. The Poster is a black and white photocopy to stress the utilitarian aspect of the information provided as well as questions divisions of value between highbrow and lowbrow art and design.

project.name: Lost Paintings
project.title: Lost Paintings
project.description: Various pantings that aren't part of a larger series.

project.name: Sonic Landscape
project.title: Sonic Landscape
project.description: Inspired by Peter Saville's iconic album cover design, sonic landscape interprets the spectrum of a given piece of audio and builds a landscape of it across the screen, certain parameters can be controlled by the user to control the characteristic of the image.

project.name: Habit of Sight
project.title: Habit of Sight
project.description: Album design for hypothetical band.

project.name: Jazzzeen
project.title: Jazzzeen:
project.description: A "Zeen" celebrating the history of jazz in America with contemporary perspectives.

project.name: Shell Lamp
project.title: Shell Lamp
project.description: Lamp buit with custom set of plasti templates that bend around each other.

project.name: Tree Sculpture
project.title: Tree Sculpture
project.description: Site specific mobile for central park.
